review_text:
Kade and Ellen's barn is my most favorite stay EVER ~ pictures cannot capture all the beauty!
The second I walked into the barn, I gasped at the wonderful smell!
Everything was pristine clean with soft linens and 5 star quality bedding. When you hop into the comfy beds, you'll once again smell the soft scent of the home.
My first night, it rained and I fell asleep listening to rain drops on a tin roof! The next morning, I enjoyed the sounds of happy birds as they dipped and dived in the nearby fields.
The cats are wonderful to watch and they are "besties" with the farm's fouls. But, it's the two working farm dogs I loved ~ they are friendly and will certainly greet you, but they are working to keep the farm animals (and guests) safe from the roving coyotes.
Kade and Ellen will make your stay absolutely perfect! Friendly, communicative, and just down right nice. Their family is simply darling and they go the extra mile just for you! Thank you so much for an awesome stay ❤️
Ellen is an exceptional host that made sure that our stay was great. The Barn was perfect for our stay and we would recommend it to everyone.
Everything about the place was great! The only concern was there were dogs loose when we arrived, which surprised us, and they barked until we were fully in the Airbnb.
Place is beautiful and roomy. Hosts went above and beyond in every way possible. Definitely stay here if you’re in the area, you won’t regret it !

We had an absolutely wonderful stay! We were in town from Colorado with our dog for the dog show and wanted to catch up with some friends who live in Kansas and this was the perfect place to meet up! The barn is out in the middle of the country, not very many amenities around so plan ahead and bring groceries and entertainment as needed - but can always make the drive to Dodge city. There is a large amount of open grass space to play corn hole and other provided yard games, grill and relax! The interior of the barn was fantastic - what a fun way to remodel a milking barn into a living space. We had a great trip and if ever back in Kansas would stay there again!
Ps the hosts even offered us fresh eggs from their chickens! The hosts are fantastic, extremely responsive and welcoming without being around too much either! (Host live in house on property away from barn)

Unique and comfortable accommodations. It made a fantastic spot to stop and refresh on our cross-country road trip. Ellen was friendly and gave clear instructions. The animals on the property were friendly and well-trained. Would stay again if I ever drive through again!
An amazing place to stay!! Felt right at home! Will be planning our second visit soon!!
Incredible price for a gorgeous huge place with a responsive and friendly host. Wish we could have stayed longer. Just passing the for the night. So comfortable and homey!
Absolutely Beautiful!! This is a wonderful place to stay!

Beautiful barn conversion with all the amenities you could possibly need! The Kansas sunset was gorgeous and we enjoyed the peace and quiet of the area. Ellen was super friendly and responsive. Would recommend.
Ellen and Kade have created an oasis. This air bnb met my expectations and then some. I’m truly grateful to have spent time here with friends and family.
Great stay. just as listed and overall very nice! Thank you.

Loved our stay with Ellen in Montezuma!
There is no better way to experience the tranquil beauty of the prairie than to stay in this renovated barn. Highly recommend on all aspects!
Perfect place! We love it here!
Once again, our group had a wonderful stay at Ellen's place. She was very helpful!
We loved staying in this comfortable home with our extended family, and enjoyed the unbeatable prairie sunrises.
Ellen was very helpful and accommodating for our group!
Enjoyed our stay! Nice place!
Beautiful barn, quiet surroundings, lots of space, and a very well stocked kitchen. It was the perfect place to spend our family Christmas with our big family.
Extremely clean space and was exactly as described. Ellen was very easy to get in contact with and always responded promptly. Her space was probably one of the best stocked Airbnbs I have rented.
Awesome stay. Close to pheasant fields
Wonderful place- better than the pictures! It was spacious, clean, and decorated beautifully. And Ellen was very responsive!
Had a great stay!
Our 3rd stay and it was a great weekend! Perfect AirBnb
We had a perfect 2nd stay! This is a beautiful home/barn in a beautiful and scenic place! Thank You

I stay at a lot of Airbnbs for business travel and for family trips. This is by far the best one we have stayed at! Everything was perfect. The home and farm are very beautiful! Ellen was a great host and made us feel at home.

"The Barn" is really nice. Very modern, updated and clean. The area is remote but quiet and tranquil.
The only issue we had was it was really hot upstairs. There were fans which we used but with one cooling system for both levels it is difficult in such high temperatures that we had to cool the upper rooms. If outdoor temperatures weren't so high I think it would probably have been fine.
The barn was better than pictures. Loved the extra touches like cot hole and giant connect four.
Great stay out in the country. My kids enjoyed seeing the different animals around the property.

We really enjoyed our stay at Ellen’s barndominium. It was perfect for what we needed. There’s plenty of room and it is so peaceful and relaxing. They were so kind to let us park our 3 cars in their huge garage because of a severe thunderstorm. Thankfully there was not any hail but we so appreciated not having to worry about it. Ellen was always responsive to my questions and very accommodating. Definitely recommend this place!

The house is exactly as pictured and very comfortable for our group which included 3 families. The beds, linens, and pillows are comfy and clean and the kitchen and living spaces gave us plenty of room to gather and enjoy our time together. We also really enjoyed being far away from any cities and feeling the peaceful ambiance of a farm setting. There are windmills all around which provided a charming flicker of light at night. We were here visiting family and would stay again if I have a future visit.
This place was perfect! A great escape from city life. Quiet, peaceful and relaxing. Ellen and her family were great. Highly recommend.

We just loved the peaceful, rustic BNB. The only regret is, we wished we could have stayed longer. We hope to make it back someday. The place was spotless and had everything we needed. This host has put so much work into making this "barn" into a very unique home and it was perfect. Thank you for everything.

We absolutely loved this place and wish we were there longer. Such a unique property with just unbelievable horizons that go on forever. This is a great stop for the through traveler or those visiting Dodge City or the casino. We would definitely stay here again.

This place is absolutely stunning! The inside is so tastefully done and you can tell a lot of care and thought went into it! It is super spacious with lots of room to relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. Ellen is easily the best host I’ve had the pleasure of interacting with! She was quick to respond and so kind throughout the entire check in and check out process. Thank you again for letting us stay, we will definitely be back. Highly recommend staying here!

The barndominium is so welcoming and well decorated. This was our second stay at this Airbnb, and we hope to return. The hosts are helpful and responsive. It’s such a pleasure to stay in accommodations so clean and well maintained. Complementary breakfast treats were so thoughtful!
Great place to stay outside Montezuma. The rooms upstairs were super cozy and a great place to hangout in a winter storm.
Wonderful host! Place was so clean and smelled wonderful. Great location.
Great place to stay!

Ellen was super to work with when our plans had to change due to flight issues. She took the time to put up a Christmas tree so our family could celebrate Christmas during our stay. She was vey accommodating to all our needs. We will definitely keep her place on our list of places to go back to again.

We loved our stay at the barn! Such a beautiful and bright place that was perfect for our family. The place was very clean and updated so nicely. The kitchen was well stocked so we could have coffee and make breakfast. We have stayed at several Airbnb rentals and this was one of the top places we've stayed. We loved everything about it and will definitely be back! Thank you Ellen for your wonderful hospitality!

This place is absolutely adorable!
Very clean and has everything we needed!!
We loved it!!
Absolutely loved our stay !!
Met up with a group of friends for the first time! Wanted a nice quiet place to kick back and relax and this was perfect!

Everything was absolutely excellent in every way! We had a 30th birthday at this location and it was the perfect facility to hold all 13 of us. We had a great time and the gracious hosts made my husbands day by bringing over a little present for him. We will definitely be back!
Everything was top notch! Great place to stay!
A dog and cute kittens greet you. Beautiful, fiery sunsets. Very accommodating host. Peaceful, one-of-a-kind stay.
Loved this place perfect for the family games and nice relaxing patio area. Quiet would definitely stay again.
we had such a an awesome stay...it truly exceeded our expectations...the hostess was so hospitable...would stay here again...Ashlie Seiler
Great place and great house, especially for larger groups. It was just me and my wife and our dog, so it was a little pricey for just us but as my wife said, it was worth every penny
Great place to stay while traveling. Very fast communication if any issues arose
Would recommend! We enjoyed our stay here. Very clean. And Ellen was super nice to work with!
This barn is an amazing place to stay in Kansas it deserves more than a 5 star. Ellen is such great host and kept in touch. Thank you ☺️

At the last minute my construction crew needed a place to stay and all of the local hotels were booked in town. I desperately reached out to Ellen and she was super friendly, helpful, and was able to easily accommodate my crew. The crew said that everything was super clean, comfortable, and welcoming. It was quiet and relaxing, had all of the basic necessities on hand, and was hands down beats any hotel they have ever stayed at. Cannot recommend this gem of a place enough!
Beautiful SW KS skyline and very nice accommodations. Ellen was extremely responsive and helpful every step of the way.

This is a truly special experience. The barndominium is so well furnished and comfortable. The host is genuine, communicative and authentic. This property embodies what the true salt of the earth and backbone of America is. This an immaculate property!

The barn had a great Cabin feel. It’s has plenty of space to spread out and was very clean and meticulously maintained. Host also took the time to suggest local activities. All together a 10 out of 10.
Excellent stay
The place was beautiful and stunningly clean. I have not had a better experience with Airbnb, and I certainly have not had a more gracious host. Can’t recommend this place enough!

If you have a family gathering or want a large place to stay, this is a great choice! It is beautiful, very clean and spacious. You will feel very at home. The upstairs rooms are perfectly adorable!! Our family loved them!! Lots of space to be outdoors. The host was prompt with communication and very gracious. Just try it out - you'll love it!
The hotel worked wonderfully for my family that was in town. Check in and out were easy! The snacks and beverages were a nice added touch for them after all their travels!

We love old historical homes & enjoyed looking around the parlor & lobby area! Sat outside in the gazebo but it was rather windy while we were there, so we decided to walk to dinner & back to our room. Lovely coffee cake for breakfast with choice of tea or coffee. Thanks for sharing your home Kathleen!
Such a great stay in a beautiful historic spot. Kathleen was so friendly and everything was just as described with some snacks waiting for me. Comfy bed, definitely recommend!

Kathleen provided great snacks, which we had s breakfast Lots of room and period decor. We delayed our departure for an hour just to keep enjoying thee parlor room. Each tour of the room revealed some thoughtful and tasteful touch.
Very genuine person!

The hotel 2nd floor was amazing; we were suddenly in a past era, surrounded by early Victorian charm that must have astounded travelers even back then! The grounds around the hotel were a welcoming, cool shady oasis of ancient lilacs, big cottonwood and pine. Best of all was the conversations with the hostess Kathleen; informative, loving insights from the past bringing depth to understanding today. Deeply grateful.
Comfy and charming

Loved our stay at Kathleen’s place! The room was very spacious and cozy. Our two dogs enjoyed having a grassy area to sniff around and enjoy as well. There were ample towels, blankets and pillows. She also left us a lovely snack basket for our stay. The room felt so “homey” ☺️

The parlor suite was beautiful, spacious and the historical details were fabulous. The bed and living room furniture were comfortable & inviting. There was a generous supply of towels and extra blankets. The bathroom had hooks galore for our robes and towels, but the complimentary basket of chips, trail mix, & energy bars was a wonderful surprise. She even had treats for our dog.

A very period spacious environment. Kathleen took me on a tour of the unit to make sure I could find everything I needed. As a bonus, she was kind enough to provide an outstanding lemon poppyseed loaf from a local bakery. Very pleasantly surprised by the availability of bright lighting which made it easy to read print materials at night. I would absolutely stay here again.
Very quaint and lovely place. Very homey. We were busy while we were there and missed getting to spend much time but Kathleen was always available. Would recommend staying there!
Great place

great space with beautiful details in every corner.
easy to deal with.
It was right in town at a convenient location. Kathleen is a friendly host.
We absolutely loved staying here! What a beautiful house, the town is cozy and charming, and Kathleen was so friendly. We wish we could have stayed longer!

Five stars, across the board. Highly recommend to all you history buffs out there, you will certainly appreciate the structure itself and the furnishings. Kathleen is a gracious host. We would definitely stay there again.
great place to stay when visiting Dodge City.
Kathleen was helpful and friendly.
Kathleen was an amazing and accommodating host!

We loved Kathleen and her space! We are lovers of history and this was a perfect space for us. Charming, cozy, and easy to find. We felt right at home. Kathleen was so friendly and made sure we were comfortable. We would definitely stay here again

it's my second time staying at Kathleen's beautiful historic old hotel Airbnb. beautiful furnishings, quiet pe and just a block off the main highway.
she always leaves this wonder bread bread for her gas from the local b just absolutely outstanding.
What an amazing place! It had everything you could need, it was cozy and the bed very comfortable! I really enjoyed my stay here!
was a beautiful historically enriched stay Ms Kathleen was an amazing host
Wonderful historic home in the heart of Cimmaron. We only stayed one night, but it was perfectly appointed, well stocked, and a very comfortable roomy place!!!

Such a beautiful place and the history is so rich! As a former archaeologist, I was loving it. There are little tidbits of the hotel’s history throughout so it was fun to explore the rooms and learn. The host, Kathleen, was excellent! Super friendly and helpful. We definitely recommend this home to anyone traveling through Kansas. Next time we travel between Colorado and our home in Arkansas, we will be sure to stop by!
Joan and I enjoyed our stay in the Parlor Suite. It was a convenient stop on our way back from Colorado to Kansas. What a fantastic historic building!
Great historic hotel. A fun place to stay. Kathleen was very responsive and accommodating.

Kathleen's historical home is a walk back in time, in a good way, warm, inviting and cozy. All comforts were covered and we slept quite well. We had a great steak dinner in Dodge City too. Very kind and interesting hostess. We highly recommend if passing through on the way to somewhere!

If you love historical buildings then this is a must. You could “feel” the past when you walked in.
Cathleen is a great host. She’s in constant communication and made sure we had everything we needed.
I wish her much success in her endeavor in preserving history.
The Parlor Room at the Cimarron Hotel was a fun place to stay and a nice change from hotels. It has lots of history and very quaint!

Always look forward to visiting Cimarron and Kathleen's property. It may have a long long history and served different purposes over the years, but so glad now we can stay over and visit with someone who is so motivated to share it's history and charm.
Thank you, again! We’ll be back.
Loved every moment.
Thank you Kathleen, enjoyed our stay! Thanks for the Gift for our Baby! Would recommend to anyone
Very nice lady and others who help out around the place! She gave us our distance, which was nice, but also would of welcomed more interaction. Everyone's different tho.

this place was adorable...absolutely charming. Kathleen keeps the suite spotless. we were very late for check-in and messaged her, she was so flexible. plenty of extra everything from towels and blankets, to snacks and nice toilet paper!! She even let us come upstairs to get some dog therapy from her sweet friends!

beautiful place to stay in this little town. I definitely would take advantage of staying here.... unique furnishings and a very old historical building. she has a fenced in backyard which is very convenient for my dog. there's a great big shop in town that has great bakery stuff as well as frozen food that you can take home like plates of enchiladas and lasagna....

We loved our stay in this historic room filled with interesting decor, magazines books, and treats; all the things we enjoy! The bed was very comfortable for a good night’s sleep. Kathleen was very accommodating and made everything easy. We also appreciate having a place that accepts our pup. We would definitely stay again.
pleasant historic old hotel.
Best place I stayed the whole trip. Got there 1/1/23 so nothing was open. Host fed me homemade soup. Historical hotel from 1886. I love history, Dodge City was open on 1/2/23 so hit some good spots.
Not much in Cimmarron but Dodge City is close. Exactly what you should expect with an old hot. The showeris a it of a challenge.

A beautifully, enchanting, historic gem! We felt right at home yet also like we stepped back in time. Kathleen’s thoughtful extras quickly made this one of our favorite places we have visited. My only regret is that we couldn’t stay longer. I don’t know what else to say other than go, it’s a wonderful experience for the inquisitive traveler.

The historic Cimarron Hotel bnb was very sweet, roomy, comfortable. More an apartment with a well-stocked kitchenette, living room, large bathroom and bedroom. Kathleen was responsive and accommodating. The bed was very comfortable. Conveniently located - walked to cool bar/restaurant in town for dinner. Highly recommend staying here!
Very comfortable historic hotel. Even though there weren’t any places open for breakfast, Kathleen had a tasty cinnamon loaf for us to enjoy in the morning. We and our dog enjoyed our stay.
The space was super roomy and with a homey feel to it. It was comfortable and private. There was a generous welcome basket with snacks and drinks in the fridge. This is a great historic property.
wonderful, unforgettable. we definitely want come back!

This stay was a highlight to our Kansas trip. Staying in a hotel this old with all the history around us. The furnishings are very nice and I would hope all families would treat this place with respect. The couch was comfy and my husband took the recliner. Our bed was warm and inviting and I would have loved to sleep late, but we had to leave early. Will stay again on our next trip.

We loved this place so much. And Kathleen was so sweet. And thoughtful. And the perfect host. We felt so comfortable staying in her beautiful hotel built in 1886 .. we look forward to returning one day. Such a great place to stay !

A very interesting and Historical Registered Landmark Hotel!! It was fascinating to read the history and the Parlor Suite was full of antiques. The Lobby is fascinating and was representative of the turn of the century. Kathleen provided snacks, beverages and a delicious pecan bread.
Wonderful stay!

super cool and comfy respite in western Kansas. 3 rooms in one, terrific communication and hospitality, and surprising treats and drinks. mDs m feel part of fhe history of the New West. thanks Lso for the tip on the local golf course!!
Very old and historic but well-appointed and comfortable
Highly recommended! This property has great character and ambience and Kathleen made us feel very welcomed. A great opportunity to experience a bit of history.
Wonderful accommodations and atmosphere. Great location… Would stay again without question!!
This hotel is a huge suite for your stay.

Beautiful historic hotel. Kathleen was the perfect hostess and accommodate our last minute travel plans to stop in Dodge City/Cimarron. We will definitely be back if we passing through the area again. Thank you
We had a great stay, it is a beautiful place. Kathleen left us homemade zucchini bread. We forgot a pair of shoes and she mailed them to us.
Absolutely stay here if you are in the Dodge City area. Great value and a truly historical abode. Kathleen is terrific and check in was seamless.
Interesting history. Good access for easy on and off highway.

What a cool place to stay and cool host. It’s a hotel that dates back to the 1880s and feels like you could be there. Of course it has wifi, great hot water pressure and televisions, but the feeling and decor is so warm and homey.
As for the host, she is a great lady who has great local history and is happy to sit and talk while you figure out where you are going next.
Kathleen is gracious and friendly. she every step of my arrival, stay, and departure simple, unhurried, and stress-free. She's very responsive and you can usually find her somewhere on the property.

If you are considering visiting Dodge City and nearby attractions, bypass the major hotels and book a stay at The Parlor Suite in the Historic Cimarron Hotel! So cozy, warm and welcoming! The space is comfy for couples to enjoy quiet time in between activities. Kathleen is wonderfully sweet, and she leaves guests a lovely assortment of snacks! Also, her property caretaker Levi is a true wanderlusting nomad with great travel trips whether you are heading east or west!
Nice, historic place. It was comfortable and quiet. The hostess is very kind and helpful.
Kathleen is warm, inviting, and communicative. The suite is large and beautiful. A great stop on a road trip!

Stopped for a quick night on a road trip. The suite was surprisingly spacious and charming. Beautiful and historic, it was full of interesting details and had everything you could need to be comfortable. Kathleen was a pleasure to communicate with. Would recommend to anyone passing through or looking to check out Cimarron and the surrounding area.

The Parlor Suite at the Cimarron Hotel was a real treat compared to a traditional suite or living space. Such history, nostalgia, and a wonderful host. We will certainly stay again next time we are in town. Hopefully, Cimarron will once again have a restaurant with breakfast - but the Bake Shop is awesome for coffee and baked goods.
Kathleen was a great host. Her place is a historic hotel of bygone days. It was a fun stay.
cute place! located between Dodge City and Garden City so it worked well for us. neat little historic stay. fantastic book, magazine, and art selection in the room!
Unbelievably amazing Airbnb. This is a hotel well over 100+ years old and very true to its age. Kathleen is very nice and helpful. Definitely the best stay of our trip!
Great place for the night!
Thank you for the awesome stay! This place is a gem and we felt super welcomed, safe and comfortable in this pretty and historical place!
Clean and comfortable. Appreciated that it was dog friendly

What a special place to stay! I enjoyed returning "home" after my long days as it is quiet, very private, and i really did feel like it was my home! I felt taken care of! The directions to check in were simple and easy to follow! The Tv worked which is sometimes a feat in airbnb's i have stayed in! i traveled with my 11 year old dog and there were dog treats on the table! This host has it all for a relaxing stay! I will come back for sure!

Such a needed respite from a long long drive! The the parlor suite is spacious enough to spread out and comfortable. The Hotel Cimmaron has great bones and cool history and is just what the listing promises.
Great place. Neat to b in such a historic place. Nice to have coffee,creamer,hot teas,friendship bread,and some snacks available.
Great spot when seeing Dodge City.

After a long night driving through storms, we were so glad to have arrived and have such a cozy spot ready for us with so much history. The decor is fun, the rooms clean, and the breakfast treat delicious. We also greatly appreciated how quickly Kathleen responds to messages and her great recommendations! Would highly recommend to anyone passing through the area.
Very comfortable.

Kathleen was a wonderful host at the historic Cimarron Hotel. She left us snacks in the Parlour Suite where it felt like home to us after a long road trip. check in and out was super easy. Thanks Again!
was very relaxing
A charming place to stay for a few days!
Kathleen is a lovely host. Staying at her hotel is like experiencing history but really comfortably.

My wife & I enjoyed our stay. It was very clean & homey.
If you appreciate small towns & historical, old homes this would be a nice stay. Our small dog was comfortable & welcomed. However, if you have a reactive dog who is triggered by barking dogs, I would not recommend this place.
Otherwise, we would stay here again.

We stopped here for a night on a trip through Kansas. We enjoyed this historic place - charming, comfortable, and quiet. The host has great communications and is very welcoming. Everything made for a great stay.
Absolutely lovely and spacious, would stay longer if we had the time!

This place rocks. The host rocks and is super responsive. The parlor suite was great. It’s huge. It’s comfortable. It has a charm that can’t be put into words. If you’re looking for an interesting and historic place to stay that is warm and welcoming, this is it. Water pressure is great too. Thanks so much.
Kathleen was a wonderful host and we absolutely adored our historic stay!
Host is great and very easy to talk with.
Welcoming and cozy with lots of good books about history. There were welcoming treats too!

Great room in more ways than one! First, it’s huge! It has a bedroom, living room, and a bathroom with room to spare. It’s also steeped in history and you can feel it in the room. It’s very cozy and we would like to have stayed and enjoyed a little longer but we were in a hurry. If you find yourself in Cimarron and need to bed down for a bit, this is the place.
Wonderful charming historic place! We loved it. Our dogs did too.
Great place with lots of history. We went with our dog and had a comfortable stay

It was a very quick stay for us as we were driving across country. Kathleen was great, even provided us some snacks, the space was big with lots of charm! Being a historic building there were creaks and sounds but I'd recommend staying if you ever find yourself passing through Kansas.

Kathleen is wonderful to work with. I stayed a few nights while working nearby. I got great sleep and would recommend Cimarron Hotel to anyone passing through. Although it closed due to season Cimarron has a magnificent looking golf course and I hope to return and play it someday.
Had everything we needed. Great place. Lots of historical character! Thanks for a great stay!

This is a real gem!
A wonderful host and an amazing historic hotel. Super cozy and easy to get in and out. It’s right along the auto tour route !
A Must stop if you are nearby!

Suite included personal living room, bedroom, bathroom, and all amenities you will want. Host responds fast and is qualitative. Everything was great, but do expect creaky fixtures expected of a historic building (particularly the light fixtures when traffic flows thru).

Kathleen’s place was welcoming and very homey. I really enjoyed staying here and got a really good nights rest. To be honest, there isn’t much to the area, but the people were very friendly as I went on my morning walk. I would stay here again and intend to if I pass through again. 🌻
great place to stay! clean and cozy.
Great stay. Will stay again next time we pass through. Comfortable bed and well-stocked. Wonderful location. Had a great dinner within walking distance.

Kathleen is so communicative. It was easy to arrive and check in. The hotel is steeped in history. A great stop for someone who’d like to step back in time, but also a great for a stopover to rest on a long drive. Truly a unique experience.
Very nice place to stay,. The Parlor suite was big, comfortable, convenient to the highway, in a warm and friendly town near Dodge City. We would stay again if passing through these parts.
what a treat!

This was by far our favorite stay. The Parlor room is large and comfortable. The bedroom is also spacious with a cozy and comfy bed. Everything, from the open communication to the total experience, was perfect for our needs!
What a fantastic place. Staying here is like stepping back in time.
Great host. Very informative and helpful. Someone who appreciates and loves dogs.

Nicely furnished.
We enjoyed the Parlor Suite.
Comfortable living room and cozy bedroom.
Air conditioning could have been quieter, but between the two units, it did get comfortable.
We enjoyed the swing in the back yard and the gazebo.
Kathleen was responsive to all our concerns and questions.
My new favorite airbnb! Kathleen is a wonderful hostess and provided thoughtful touches to make our stay special. The hotel is so beautiful and it was a treat to stay in such a historic place.
Thank you Kathleen!

Thank you Kathleen. We love history and enjoyed stepping back in time. Thank you for all your work in preserving this piece of history. Our suite was very nice, comfortable bed, sofa and chair and nice snacks and drinks. The TV and WiFi work great too.

Everything was great with her stay at the Cimmaron hotel. Thank you Kathy!. If you like to go back in history this is one stop on your way through Kansas or just stay and check out the different history stops.
We rode our motorcycles over and it was a great ride nice parking, location cleanliness historic hotel and you just found yourself back in the day and history.
There were snacks for us on the table, a delicious friendship bread, coffee bar of water end it just gave us a very relaxing weekend.
Lots to say within an hour of driving distance and lots of quaint little restaurants and good food.
Rhonda and Rob
Wonderful! Quaint and quiet.

My husband and I would return to this lodging “in a heartbeat” if we travel back to western Kansas/Dodge City. We indeed felt that we were briefly time traveling when we entered the front door of the hotel. The suite itself is a comfortable and spacious three rooms (including bath) with bookcases and soft oriental style carpets on old wood floor. At every reading area there is a lamp, both in the living room and bedroom. The sofa is long and looks new and welcoming for falling asleep reading on a rainy day. The climate control equipment worked well on a very hot summer day. There is great lighting in the bathroom also.
I appreciate good lighting and as these ceilings are exceptionally (such as 19th century) high this is important. Morning sun lights up the front room through lace curtains. There are privacy curtains for night. Quiet ceiling fan in the living room. The table in the eating area is perfect for computer work as well. Coffee for the Mr. Coffee, creamer, water in the fridge, and a small breakfast cake were much appreciated.
Owner Kathleen has been a steward of this remarkable property for decades and will share her knowledge of the 1886 hotel and all things Kansas. She is, as others have written, lovely and personable.
Highly recommend. Very comfortable and nostalgic to the area. Kathleen is a very accommodating hostess. Loved our stay.
Good place to rest for a few hours
What a piece of history! An easy check in with proximity to Dodge City make this place an amazing experience. The decor is beautiful, and The Cimarron couldn't have a nicer host.

We had such an amazing stay at Kathleens. She was so warm and welcoming, the suite was exactly as advertised, and this was the perfect stopover with close access to Dodge City! Would highly recommend!!
It was really lovely!
Wonderful suite in an historic hotel in a tiny town - Kathleen was an amazing gracious host and very communicative

The parlor suite was very comfortable and homey. The whole building had period decorations everywhere, and was adorable. Kathleen even left us a nice welcome basket with snacks, and cold drinks in the refrigerator. The next time we're in western Kansas we will absolutely stay here again. Also don't miss the bakery/coffee shop!
5 satrs

What a fun and relaxing time we had at Kathy's place! The history of the Cimarron Hotel is so rich and one really feels a part of that history staying there. I needed a place to work out of for about 10 days and I travel with dogs for work. The hotel was everything I needed and more. It really felt magical staying in such a beautiful and historical inn. The apartment was spacious and cool even with weeks of over 100-degree heat. The bed is super comfortable and the couch is too. I was able to get a lot of work done in the space while I was there. My dogs felt like queens of the Cimarron Castle. Kathy is a serious dog-lover too. And the yards and grounds of the hotel are gorgeous. So much shade and green grass. I am hoping to return in the fall!
Very cozy! Loved it

The room was quaint and as advertised. Fresh cinnamon raisin and blackberry bread, a coffee maker, a basket of snacks and cold drinks awaited us. Our hostess was kind and quite knowledgable. We simply loved our stay!!
Could not recommend this place more. Very cozy, like staying with a beloved relative, and unbelievably charming
